sentences.en: It was the third time the prime minister had employed the prorogue in as many years.
sentences.cn: 这是多年以来首相第三次实施休会。

sentences.en: Parliament be prorogue for the summer recess.
That's exactly what Canadian Prime Minister Stephen Harper did in early 2010, employing a time-honored Canadian political tactic known as a "prorogue" to shut down parliamentary debate.
sentences.cn: 这正是加拿大首相史蒂芬·哈珀在2010年初所做的，使用久负盛名、被称为“休会”的加拿大政治策略停止议会辩论。

sentences.en: The legislature moved to prorogue the present session.
sentences.cn: 立法机关提议停止目前的会议.

trans.tran_en: to discontinue the meetings of (a legislative body) without dissolving it
